source.e9e114d3: ** How many Job Titles were represented by only one person in 2013? (e.g. Job Titles with only one occurence in 2013?) **
source.0517110e: ** What is the name of lowest paid person (including benefits)? Do you notice something strange about how much he or she is paid?**

source.b869f06a:
# Pandas Exercise 

In this exercise we will be using the [SF Salaries Dataset](https://www.kaggle.com/kaggle/sf-salaries) from Kaggle! Just follow along and complete the tasks outlined in bold below.
source.ad8d33cb: ** Read Salaries.csv as a dataframe called sal.**
source.157bb2ee: ** What was the average (mean) BasePay of all employees per year? (2011-2014) ? **
source.080a096b: ** Use the .info() method to find out how many entries there are.**
source.2cc239f2: ** What are the top 5 most common jobs? **
source.f826c1ae: ** What is the job title of  JOSEPH DRISCOLL ? Note: Use all caps, otherwise you may get an answer that doesn't match up (there is also a lowercase Joseph Driscoll). **
source.42124e4b: ** How much does JOSEPH DRISCOLL make (including benefits)? **
source.1b83c892: ** What is the highest amount of OvertimePay in the dataset ? **
source.e1d22443: ** How many unique job titles are there? **
source.0f54e026: ** How many people have the word Chief in their job title? **
